Reviews.Title: “Great sushi restaurant, hideous room”
Reviews.Author: DiscerningDC
Reviews.Content: I'n not sure if I was just unlucky but the room I got at this hotel made my skin crawl. If this place doesn't have bedbugs, I'm a Dutchman. After staying at 60 Thompson, I was stunned that this was the same chain. Have sushi, avoid staying.

Reviews.Title: “no problems here!”
Reviews.Author: Stella3000
Reviews.Content: Very quiet, nice one night stay! Included a newspaper in the morning :-) but I don't think wifi. The staff was very nice. The room was clean, a little small and dark, not too luxurious feeling, but it was fine. We booked this according to a good price, also had a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: PN_Chicag0
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a good value in this area, I would highly recommend 6 Columbus. I booked my room through a last minute travel app, so the price was extremely reasonable. The room was the typical NYC tiny size, but it was spotlessly clean, the furniture appeared to be new, and the bed was extremely comfortable. The bathroom was surprisingly spacious, had a heated floor, and quality Kiehl's soap/shampoo/conditioner was provided. I was a bit surprised not see an iron or ironing board in the room, but I'm sure the hotel staff would have brought one to me had I asked. The staff were quite prompt in providing the extra bed sheet that I requested. The front desk staff and doormen were extremely friendly and gave me some excellent tips on nearby entertainment options. On my next trip to New York, when considering my hotel options, 6 Columbus will be at the very top of my list. I cannot emphasize enough how pleasant my stay here was.

Reviews.Title: “6 Columbus deserved 6 stars...”
Reviews.Author: Craig_Finley
Reviews.Content: From check-in to check-out the staff at 6 Columbus was top notch. The property reminded me of a stay in a boutique hotel in South Beach Miami. I booked with an internet travel site for a last minute deal, and was supposed to move to a different hotel for the last two days of my stay. I enjoyed the first night so much, I asked if they had availability to extend, and they did, so I cancelled the other stay. The location is amazing, at the top of W 58th just as you enter Columbus Circle. It was an easy walk to Times Sq/Broadway and Hell's Kitchen resturants, A subway stop is directly across the street. I was in a king room and did not find the room to be loud from street noise as I have in past NYC hotels. Also found the room size to be bigger than what I normally expect from NYC. Room was nicely decorated, not over the top with a good color scheme. The heated floor in the bathroom was a nice surprise. Be sure to check out the roof deck, it wasn't open for the season for service, but was open to sit and work from, it was a nice quiet "retreat" from a busy day of work. As others have mentioned the restaurant is supposed to be amazing, but it was full each night I wanted to try it. People waiting to go in did also rave about the food. The staff can truly make or break your experience, and as mentioned in the opening they were just amazing. Welcoming you back each time you returned, and consistently checking to make sure everything was top notch. I'll be sure to return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location and Friendly Service”
Reviews.Author: atxgal718
Reviews.Content: Location: Fantastic! Right on the south west corner of Central Park, across from the Time Warner Center and Columbus Circle/59th Street subway stop. Easy walk to most Broadway theaters and Times Square is just a smidge further. Seemed like there were several great restaurants nearby as well. Service: Superb! All attendants were very responsive and enthusiastic. The concierge also provided two great recommendations as well. Room: Very nice. Decor was fabulous. The bed was very comfortable.The main unfortunate thing was that the bed platform juts out just enough to make a sharp edge. Both my companion and I hit our shins on the edge---ouch! The other issue was the lighting in the room was a little dim for anything detailed, but sufficient for general use. The bathroom was surprisingly spacious. And the tiles were heated, which was awesome! WiFi: Unfortunate---$15. There's a Starbucks next store with free WiFi and ample seating.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay but it's really not on Columbus”
Reviews.Author: Taipeiworldlywise
Reviews.Content: My first trip to NYC and I can't say enough good things about it, and the stay at the hotel was a great bonus. I went in Feb so super low season in NYC so hotels were having sales left, right and center. (On a side note, if you can put up with the cold, great time to go! all the good things NYC has to offer without the pesky tourists) I wanted to shop in NYC so as a concession, I decided to cut the budget for expensive five star hotels and opted for more affordable boutique options. 6 Columbus was suggested to me and i booked a pod thinking that if I can survive in Tokyo living in their pods, I can definitely survive in New York. Fortunately, I didn't have to find out. I was upgraded without asking as I checked in. Room didn't have a view but was spacious and clean. For one night, it was great. The service was extremely good and everyone is super friendly. Would definitely stay here again. Only one little thing, you have to pay for wifi... felt a little 2008ish. Who charges for wifi anymore? Forked over my $15 and that was that.

Reviews.Title: “Bijou hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: elbrod
Reviews.Content: This is not my first Thompson hotel nor my last. There seems to be a formula that works for my demographic in these hotels, with distinguishing characteristics defining each individual property. This hotel is perfectly situated for the subway, which is 1 minute away, the Time Warner building, Lincoln Center and other Upper East Side attractions. Rooms are small but charming in a minimal but comfortable way, great sheets and bath products, etc. My only complaint is a $15 charge for the internet, just can't understand why a hotel with such classy aspirations would stoop to this charge, especially because there's free wi-fi in an adjacent Starbuck's. Apart from that quibble, everything else was fabulous, with very attentive doormen/valets who actually act as concierges, and an obliging front desk staff. I had a great rate, I guess because it was off-season, and was upgraded to a larger room, which really made me feel I was getting something for nothing. The bathroom was under heated, In summary, I would recommend this hotel to anyone who chooses this area as a desirable one in NYC. I will definitely be back in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: JFM1973
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel in a location that can't be beat. It is literally across the street from the subway and half a block from Central Park. Ralph is a fantastic manager and is very willing to address guests' inquiries. Front desk staff was attentive and the valets are among the best I've encountered in NYC. For the people saying the place is small, welcome to New York! Every hotel room in the city for less than $500/night is small. This is a boutique hotel, not a Hilton. If you want a mega hotel, stay elsewhere. Clean and wonderfully decorated as well. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Molly49685
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at other Thompson properties and this was equally nice. Nice decor, great location, clean rooms. Really friendly and helpful staff. Reasonable rate.

Reviews.Title: “great small boutique hotel right in COlumbus circle”
Reviews.Author: Rick30
Reviews.Content: Great location and price. The king superior suite eas delighful with a nice outside patio with table and chairs. really enjoyed the outside space in NYC!!THe room was a good size too. I really like the wood floors in the room, it seems cleaner than carpet. The front desk was very accomodating with late check out too! The only negative was the front desk staff. They werent so friendly, they were very good at what they did but not overly friendly.Mayve aI just caught them at a bad time. Besides that I would recommend the hote and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Good Value”
Reviews.Author: vnelson2
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this hotel was perfect. Friendly staff, great price on the room (Priceline), immaculately clean, chic bath & decor, fantastic location for our evening at Lincoln Center. I'd stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “BAD EXPERINCE”
Reviews.Author: Marcelo L
Reviews.Content: Horrible service, no wifi working on all my stay, dirty and old ann bad decoration. no closet enough.The restaurant too noisy anmd took jÂ¡hours for the food to come. No people at the front desk. the looby and the entrance of the hotel full of people drinking or smoking. not a hotel to go!!!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Room and Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: 64Br_B
Reviews.Content: I travel to NYC on business at least 2 times a month and have stayed in numerous hotels all over the city. After staying at the Columbus 6 I will no longer stay anywhere else. From the extremely good location (on Columbus Circle with best Subway access in the city and Whole Foods across the street), incredibly large and clean rooms, and almost overly polite staff, there is no better value in the all of Manhattan. Also, the restaurant in the lobby, Blue Ribbon, has arguably the best Sushi in the city. I recommend this spot to anyone visiting NYC on business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Above average, below very good...”
Reviews.Author: bayimc
Reviews.Content: Let's start with the good: - I liked the 60's airport theme that is going on inside, - It's cool that the sushi bar is tied to the hotel from the reception area, - The hotel is very well located (that is if you're a midtown/uptown sort of a person), - Prices were reasonable for the location - Problem-less house-keeping; timely papers in the morning Moving on to the dark side: - I had to arrive at 7AM in the morning, and I only got my room by 3PM, the regular check-in time; nothing off the books there, but they could have tried a bit more to accommodate me... - The 'complimentary upgrades' that are being referred to in all those reviews is either a lot of very lucky guests, or a smell of self-promoting reviews... (I hope that's not the case and that I'm sensing wrong) I would assume so, because I didn't get one, and I had to wait 8 hours for the check-in and it was my birthday, and they knew it from an email exchange. - The room was cold in appearance and mood (lack of carpeting plays a big role in this) - It looked right into an old residential building just a few feet away; got no sunshine and I had to keep the curtains covered at all times in order not to be face-to-face with the other building anyways... - You could hear absolutely everything from the rooms on either sides, as well as any little sound on the corridor - No complimentary Wi-Fi anywhere in the hotel?! What century is this in? - There was a permanent smell of manure on the corridor of our floor Overall, I guess it was OK... Would I stay there again; not if it will replicate the first experience.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like our own cool apartment....”
Reviews.Author: Freofan
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a King suite ( couple with 18 year old son) for a week in early January 2012. We asked for a nice room and we had a great view over to the Time-Warner building, so we could see how the day was shaping up weather wise and just look at all the street life. The room was really quiet. My son was happy as on the sofa bed in the living room with his own TV. All the staff were amazingly nice and the concierge got us NFL play-off tickets at short notice which was hugely appreciated. We love the vibe of small boutique hotels. You feel like you are coming home. The bar is great and the sushi restaurant is brilliant in the hotel. The location is fantastic. My husband would go running in Central Park. The subway is 100m away. The Whole Foods shop in the Time Warner is brilliant to have across the road. That whole place is great actually with brilliant restaurants. The hotel has a great terrace for drinks with fab views. The only downer is the $15 for wi-fi every day.We all have iPads and computers and to log in all would have been a waste but we love our own devices! We had loads of luggage because we were travelling with all our snowboard gear and we had plenty of space. We got a great room rate by booking on-line and loved staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Thompson standards.”
Reviews.Author: Global_Nomadista
Reviews.Content: Very disappointing experience overall. I have stayed at other Thompson hotels and this was a total surprise at how poor the quality was. The lobby is shabby and tiny, as are the rooms. The customer service is awful, and that was one half of the problem. The main issue was that it was EXTREMELY loud in the hallway next to my room (43) beginning early in the morning. I got no sleep. Finally I called down at 9 am to ask for earplugs. I mentioned the issue for a second time during checkout and was given absolutely no recourse or reason to come back. The girl said a flippant 'sorry!' and turned away. Absolutely surprising and terrible. I have spent a huge amount of money on events, parties, celebrations and nights out at Thompson properties and do not plan to return after this experience.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, adequate rooms, convenient location on Columbus Circle”
Reviews.Author: AlanIlagan
Reviews.Content: On one of the coldest days of the year, a little boxwood in a tall black planter shivers in the wind outside of the lobby of 6 Columbus. Tufted leather banquettes sparsely populated with bursts of bright pillows afford a bit of seating while I wait for my room to be ready. Two complaints of rooms with no heat have already been lodged at the front desk, and as the wind whips by the window this doesnâ€™t seem to bode well. The lobby, fronted by two very friendly door-men, is a balance of light and dark â€“ coolly modern in style, like the rest of the hotel, but warmed by the staff. A sushi restaurant (Blue Ribbon Sushi Bar & Grill) is set off to the side, affording a tantalizing glimpse of a light wooden bar. While Columbus Circle is not usually an area in which Iâ€™d stay while visiting New York, an online special ($140 a night, before taxes) lured me to 6 Columbus, and Iâ€™d heard good things about the parent company that runs it (Thompson Hotels). A slightly dim elevator and hallway, the textured navy blue walls and dark floors eating up much of the light, lead to room #77. Like most New York accommodations, the pod rooms here are on the slightly smaller side of things (175 square feet), so it might be worth it to upgrade to a larger one if possible. The bathroom is more ample, backed by glossy navy tiles and brightly polished Waterworks fixtures. Bolstered by Kiehlâ€™s hair products and white fluffy towels, it is a modern, elegant space, even if an over-hyped Frette bathrobe errs on the side of starchy rather than soft. Above the bed is a large Guy Bourdin print, echoing the proclaimedâ€œ60â€™s modernistâ€� inspiration point for the hotel. The bed itself is comfortable, but not laid out with any top sheets â€“ only a duvet. Iâ€™m neither picky nor grossed out about such things, and, as long as the heat was working, didnâ€™t have need for extra bedding. A word about the heat: despite my concerns upon hearing the complaints of other patrons, the heat in my room worked just fine â€“ but it didnâ€™t make it into the bathroom, which was a great deal cooler (not the ideal situation for January). I had to overcompensate in the bedroom to warm the tiled space, but it was nothing a hot shower didnâ€™t fix. On a Sunday night, the room remains pleasingly quiet, affording an uninterrupted evening of sleep. The next morning, as I make my way to the elevator, the unmistakable odor of pot hangs lightly in the air, while knocks and calls of â€œhousekeepingâ€� go unanswered. Another average day in New York has begun.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: janine a
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I reserved the king deluxe room. When we arrived, we were surprised to have the front desk girl upgrade us complimentary to the king suite!!! It was like our own little modern apt!!! The room was so clean, the bed was super comfy , the pillows were like heaven, the staff was extremely friendly, and the restaurant at the hotel, Blue Ribbon, is DELICIOUS!!! This is a must stay hotel if you are traveling to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: SReagan82
Reviews.Content: We stayed at 6 Columbus for a couple of days before Christmas. The sta were just terrific. We arrived before noon, and we were allowed to check in early. The girls at the desk one day had terrific recommendations for Thai restaurants. The bellman seemed to read our minds about storing our luggage for several hours when we checked out. Great in all regards! The rooms are small, as we expected. But the beds are as comfortable as our bed at home, the linens are top notch, and the location can't be beat. I loved the heated tile floor in the bathroom. I do wish that they had free wi- fi. We used the Starbucks next door instead.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Boutique in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Gina N
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at 6 Columbus right after NYE and we couldn't have been happier. It is in a great location but isn't one of those big, touristy hotels. Decor of a hotel is very important to me and 6 Columbus was sleek and modern but still welcoming. The staff was very helpful, and even gave us a complimentary room upgrade so we could stay on the same floor as the other couple we were meeting there.Being in NY and so close to Columbus Circle, we expected the usual city sounds at night. I was shocked that we could not hear any noise inside our room; I am not exaggerating, the room was completely sound-proof. We are excited to try the rest of the Thompson hotels in NY and other cities.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: emiana
Reviews.Content: This is a perfectly located and perfectly priced little hotel. It's right near a subway that will get you uptown and downtown, near Central Park and all the shops at Columbus Circle. The rooms are spacious enough and there is plenty of storage space if you're staying a couple of days (look on the side of the bed - the drawers are there). Rooms and bathroom were spotless. Bed was super comfortable. And best of all - and despite its super central location - the room was exceptionally quiet. We had a rear facing room, so no view, but we didn't care about that. Quiet was more important. Cute little roof bar as well. And we didn't spend a fortune.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location for Weekend in NYC”
Reviews.Author: shwanee
Reviews.Content: Location, Location, Location! 6 Columbus is located on the southwester corner of Central Park. It's within walking distance of many classic sites, 5th Avenue, Broadway, and you can spend any downtime just sitting in Central Park! The subway entrance was located across the the street which is really convenient. Starbucks is right next door and a pharmacy is two doors down. Great for last minute snacking, water/soda etc. Time Warner Plaza is across the street with a variety if higher-end retail stores and a few restaurants. The hotel is trendy, and on the small-side like any older, boutique hotel in a big city. It was clean, updated, cozy, and quiet. The staff is very attentive and helpful with our "first-timer" questions. We plan on returning for another visit and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Neat Boutique”
Reviews.Author: bscotchnh
Reviews.Content: The usual hotel sites don't seem to have this one, but Quikbook did, and I'm very pleased about that. My wife and I wanted to spend an overnight Christmas weekend in NYC, and this was the area of the City that we wanted. Although I'm quite familiar with this part of Manhattan, I had difficulty finding the hotel, and I actually had to telephone for directions. Not withstanding its Columbus Circle address, it is actually located on the south side of 58th Street, between 8th and 9th Avenues. Since 58th Street is one way East bound, you may have to circle around somewhat before being in a position to access the hotel from 9th Avenue (which is one way South bound). It is worth it. Small, and edgy in decor, with very accomodating personnel. Before I could finish my inquiry about a complimentary upgrade, the woman behind the check-in desk let me know that she had already upgraded us two categories. What a great welcome! We appreciated the room size and decor; especially the bathroom, with its vertical black tiles, interesting lighted mirror, and heated tile floor. Directly across 48th Street is the Time Warner Building, with its upscale shopping and dining, and wonderful views East across Central Park South. But, on the side of 6 Columbus there is a Subway sandwich shop on one side and a Starbucks on the other. Lots of dining choices here, and there is also the small Japanese restaurant within 6 Columbus. No negatives to report. If the price is right when you plan to stay there, 6 Columbus is a top rate quiet and unhurried hotel choice for west side mid-town New York.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly boutique hotel right next to Central Park!”
Reviews.Author: DallasTX_Angel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the 6 Columbus on a lively weekend just before Thanksgiving. We wanted a hip vibe that was as close to Central Park as possible but with a price tag we could afford, and that's exactly what we received! This hotel is right on the south-west corner of Central Park and it was so wonderful to wake up everyday and stroll through. You are also walking distance to all of the fabulous shops like FAO Schwarz, Tiffany, and others down 5th Avenue. Each of the staff members we meet were so friendly. Form the hostess, to the doorman to the bellhop- each so accommodating and warm. We even received a complimentary room upgrade when we arrived, with out even asking. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants an affordable-yet shiek hotel in the middle of it all in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “HIP BUT NOT SNOTTY”
Reviews.Author: tobeginwith
Reviews.Content: I really like this hotel. It's hip but not snotty, the rooms are varied in sizes from small to not so small (it's a NYC boutique hotel so that's what you get!) but they are nicely appointed, have great bedding and lovely tiled bathrooms. The lighting is the only thing that needs work. The rooms are very dark but I'm sure if you asked they would offer more lamps or brighter bulbs. The location is terrific if you like midtown. You're across the street from Columbus Circle shops, the subway is steps away, great restaurants (including the hotel's own Japanese eatery) are within earshot, and a 24 hour Duane Reed is on the corner. All in all, a thumbs up for another fine Thompson hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special.”
Reviews.Author: Bman_traveler
Reviews.Content: Location is great, and I liked the restaurant. At breakfast, they served a very tasty Western breakfast in a bento box. My room was tired looking and needed to be remodeled. I could not get WiFi in my room. I switched my room three time in order to obtain a room with Wifi, but none of the rooms they put me in had Wifi. This was a problem as I was on a business trip. I had to sit in the lobby with my laptop, The Wifi issues is enough to keep me from coming back. The concierge was extremely helpful organizing my evening plans.

Reviews.Title: “avoid the crowds and stay central”
Reviews.Author: thesuperfoodchef
Reviews.Content: This little boutique hotel is in the best location ever, across from Central Park and walking distance to everything in midtown and beyond. They offer larger rooms with wood floors, as well, elegant bathrooms, robes and all the usual items and services of fine hotels. This hotel features the amazing Blue Ribbon sushi restaurant where it is a sport just to watch the elegant plating of the dishes as they are made. If you want a fine hotel without the large crowds of many Manhattan hotels, this place is for you. If you travel frequently, they will remember your visits and treat you well!!

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: Matthew C
Reviews.Content: Positives for this place are a great staff, pretty nice interior design, and a great location if you want/need to be midtown. The small "superior" room was both too small and too poorly laid out for two people. No place to put your suitcases except on the floor next to the bed, no counter space in the bathroom for your toiletries, no room for a chair between the desk and the bed. We switched to a suite (they gave us a good deal) and that room was excellent. Nicely laid out, plenty of room in the bathroom and living room. There were a few imperfections - the pop-up plugs for computers and whatnot on the desk were broken; one of the TV's didn't work (but they came in and fixed it rapidly late Sunday night). The rooms aren't designed with quite enough light. Finally (small niggle) the water pressure is very high and the faucet mechanism isn't smooth, so I splashed water all over everything almost whenever turning it on.

Reviews.Title: “A 'Gem' @ Central Park”
Reviews.Author: Martin_I_R
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is great - we stayed there a few times on business trips in 2009 and 2010 and will come again - the stays were always around the +200US$ mark per day which is very reasonable (watch out for the rates sometimes they can go high!). Some rooms are small and not super quiet - but what you expect in NY? NY is not exactly the country side! Staff is great, cleaners are super friendly and keep the place tidy and blitz your room. Front Door people are Super Friendly and Super Helpful with Peter being Extra Super Friendly! The Subway & Central Park is across the street, Wine Shop, Whole Foods and Starbucks just a few steps away.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Baciamille7
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights. I was there for the NYC Marathon and 2 days of business. The location, which is why I chose it, is fantastic. Subway right across the street and restaurants and Whole Foods within steps. Plus Starbucks next door! However, I don't think the hotel is worth the $440 per night I spent. I specifically asked for a really quiet room, and was put next to the elevator. They moved me to what seemed like a more quiet room closer to the back, at the top of a staircase that I hoped wasn't used. Wrong! From 5am every morning, there were people going up and down those stairs. By the time I realized, after a bad sleep, I had unpacked all of my race stuff and didn't want to move the night before the marathon. So I had to resort to buying earplugs!! Not what I expect for $440! When I spoke to the manager, she said that they'd upgrade me to a suite THE NEXT TIME I come! When I explained that there wasn't going to be a next time, she seemed pretty unconcerned! No desire to make the customer happy THIS time. On a positive note, the doormen were fantastic, and so helpful and friendly. I've stayed at the sister hotel, Hudson, up the road and this hotel feels like a barely renovated budget hotel in comparison, with youth hostel hallways. With such a huge selection of hotels in this city, and being a frequent traveler thre, this was certainly not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Not as advertised...and should be avoided”
Reviews.Author: gogogaga
Reviews.Content: As many guests have noted, the rooms here can be small. Comes with the territory...except when they advertise otherwise. If you advertise a room is 300 square feet, it should not be so much smaller that a guest feels the need to measure it and confirm he's not nuts. If you then offer an upgrade, at least THAT room should be 300 square feet...nope. In order to get a room the size I was promised I was offered the chance to pay up - the "discounted" rate being nearly twice the rate I reserved at - to get what I was promised in the first place. Add drab, dimly lit rooms, expensive and slow wifi, tiny cupboards instead of closets, and a lack of service elevators so that the guest elevators are often filled with staff and equipment, and the end result is a terrible experience and a terrible value. I stay in about a hundred different hotel rooms a year. Some are better than others. But as long as they meet expectations I'm fine. False advertising, with the audacity to demand more money rather than simply moving me to a room that meets the advertised specification, is awful. This is beneath the Thompson chain - well below their standards. Shame on them.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room, clean, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Algerkd
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel through the Hotel Tonight app. We stayed two nights. The room had a full bed and was tiny. We had a forth floor room wiith no view. Check in and out were fast. Cool retro decor. Doormen were all very nice and helpful when we needed a cab. Room was clean. Bathroom had a heated tile floor which was really nice! Complimentary New York Times paper each morning. Starbucks right next door and a Pinkberry frozen yogurt place not far away. Right next to central park. I would defiantly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “6 Columbus - pleasant enough”
Reviews.Author: Odette_my
Reviews.Content: I stayed here together with 2 friends from 7-9 October 2011. Our stay was pleasant enough with a comfortable room (if a little smallish) - location is good, near Central Park and is an easy walk to Times Square and the Theatre District. Not bad if you are looking for a hotel on the West Side. We booked a room for four, but were only provided 2 towels. IT would have been better if the hotel could have anticipated this and provided extra towels and amenities without our having to ask.

Reviews.Title: “It's not the Hudson!”
Reviews.Author: AlanLondon_UK
Reviews.Content: Tries hard to match the Hudson further up the road (which is similarly priced)' but doesn't quite make it. If room prices are the same when you look, then go for the Hudson every time. That said, the location is great, and the restaurant is good. My room was tiny, and the aircon was incredibly noisy (and the control unit was broken).

Reviews.Title: “A delight as always.”
Reviews.Author: Jazzpedal
Reviews.Content: I 've stayed at 6 Columbus before, and there is a reason why I come back. Friendly staff, clean and neat rooms, newspapers at the door, quick roomservice and not to forget; the location. With it's perfect spot on the south-western corner of Central Park there is a short way to engaging scenery such as the park, Times Square, Upper West Side, an the subway just across the street. The hotel is by noe means a cheap B&B, but by my opinion you get what you pay for; a chic-boutique style hotel. I have already booked my next stay here, and I am looking forward to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, amazing location”
Reviews.Author: Sam-in-Toronto
Reviews.Content: I would definitely stay here again. Yes, the pod rooms are very small, but the queen rooms are just fine, especially the queen deluxe and well worth a few extra dollars. Ask nicely and, like me, you may get a complimentary upgrade. Staff is friendly and accommodating. The first night of a 3 night stay we had noisy neighbors but, after one call to the front desk, they fell silent within 5 minutes. Decor is chic and spotless, great bed and linens, location is directly across the street from an entrance to the Time-Warner Center. Beware the address! The hotel is not actually on Columbus Circle! It is on West 58th, just west of 9th Ave., a stones throw from the circle, but confusing for some taxi drivers.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: mtf523
Reviews.Content: 6 Columbus is exactly the hotel I look for. Super clean rooms with a minimilist approach to design, the rooms are perfect. The rooms are definitely small but for us all we do is sleep in the room at night and we are rarely there. The prime location is central to everything NY has to offer, but especially Columbus Circle, Central Park and the Upper West Side with it's good shopping and restaurants. The price was lower than others that I had looked at, and for that I would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: stylcounsel
Reviews.Content: the rooms are tiny and the corner of the beds leave black and blue marks on the shins if you get too close, but other than that(and the lack of espn 2 according to my husband) this hotel is clean, hip and convenient to everything including the us open.

Reviews.Title: “The best! This is the one to choose.”
Reviews.Author: winsheeper
Reviews.Content: We reluctantly booked at 6 Columbus, fearing bed bugs, teeny room, city noise, etc. But we had to attend a wedding and this was the chosen hotel, so book we did. Well, we were in for a huge surprise. No bed bugs, huge room, excellent soundproofing. But that was only the beginning. Our spacious room was equipped with flat screen TV, modern furnishings including a cowhide rug, wonderfully comfortable bed, large windows that actually opened, efficient AC, Keihl toiletries, daily cleaning, nightly turndown, and NYT at the door each morning. And did I mention the location? Steps from beautiful Columbus Circle and Central Park, across the street from the Shops and subway, next door to Starbucks. We loved this hotel so much that we will definitely go back again for a getaway. But I have to say that far and away the best part of this hotel was the staff. Literally every employee we came across had a smile, a greeting, a genuine desire to be of assistance. And that is what will bring us back.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay there again”
Reviews.Author: NorCalHereAndThere
Reviews.Content: You can't complain about small rooms. It's New York. Rooms are small. Besides, you shouldn't be hanging out in your room. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The location is great. The bell staff is the best I've seen any place. They were friendly and helpful. Actually, they were more helpful than the front desk staff. The bar on the top floor was a nice quiet spot (in early spring at least); much better than the "scene" at the Empire Hotel where I had also recently stayed. The only issue is telling cab drivers where to take you. The address is not 6 Columbus Circle. Call ahead and get directions from the staff so that your cab ride from the airport goes smoothly. I will plan to stay here during my next trip to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “You Step Out, then Boom! The World!”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravelerSorta
Reviews.Content: I took the overnight bus from Boston and spent Saturday and Sunday in New York. I slept Saturday night at 6 Columbus. You step out of the hotel, then boom! The whole world is right there. The hotel is literally across the Time Warner building, which houses the obnoxiously called Shops, the equally pretentious but delicious WholeFoods Market, and the Mandarin Oriental. Needless to say, the hotel is centrally located, the subway train that will take you everywhere and nowhere is right there, as well. The smallest room is more than adequate for 2 people, granted I traveled solo so the room seemed more than enough for me. Space-wise, if you simply need a room, bathroom, closet, tv, and a few choice selections on snacks and needs (including a most excellent pack of condoms), the room is worth the money. (I included a picture here.) There is a bar only available to members/guests. The Japanese restaurant, housed in the lobby, is both a restaurant and the hotel's source of room service, which, I believe, is available until about 2AM. I cannot speak to these, as I did not order from the restaurant nor checked out the bar. The staff is friendly, and the doormen are cute, complete with white button down shirts, black tie, tight pants, and equally crisp bodies to match. Men aside, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with tiny, dark room.”
Reviews.Author: RoamerLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: Contrary to what other reviewers have said, the staff at the hotel was very friendly and helpful when we were there in mid July. Our room, a Superior King, was tiny with windows facing the adjacent building which was only about 10-feet away. Room was so small, and so dark we felt claustrophobic. We loved the location, and would stay here again if we could get a larger room at the front of the hotel facing the street.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every way”
Reviews.Author: Tim C
Reviews.Content: I had checked out early from the hotel next door because it was so bad, and checking into 6 - boy am I glad I did! The staff are exceptional, from the concierge, to front desk, to bar staff on the terrace, to the guys out front - all helpful, cheerful, and beautiful! The rooms are great! Big comfy bed, lovely decor, stunning bathroom etc etc. The location is great too, a few hundred yards from Central Park. I'm checking out tomorrow, and I'll be sad to leave. Thanks guys!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a nice little boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: dreamz76
Reviews.Content: Lots of Pros: A nice boutique hotel, with updated contemporary furnishing. Super clean. Right on Columbus Circle - within walking distance to the many restaurants on the Upper West and Hell's Kitchen. Well priced. The subway stop is just across the street. Cons The lobby is very small - much like most boutique hotels NYC. Probably not very child friendly, we went pre-kid and loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: roxe030
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our hotel stay. The location was convenient for us to be able to visit Times Square and Central Park. Subway stop was across from hotel and cab fare to Penn Station was not expesive. We had breakfast at the hotel which was very good, and they also have a nice rooftop bar. The bedroom we were in ( deluxe double ) was a nice size room and the beds/bedding were very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Good NYC value”
Reviews.Author: Member000
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the 6 Columbus a total of ~ 30 nights over the past 2 years on business. I've stayed in everything from the teeny little Pod rooms (a little claustrophic) to the mambo-sized King suite (as big as many NYC apartments). The rooms are consistently comfortable and clean, but can feel small. But you can't beat the location for Midtown West/Upper West Side destinations--the Time Warner Center across the street has upscale shopping and (very conveniently) a Whole Foods Market for breakfast/lunch/dinner. Or there are at least 2 diner/cafe type stores on the block, and of course any number of great restaurants within a 10-minute walk. I generally don't view myself as hipster enough to stay at a hotel like this--the bar/restaurant in the lobby is very much a scene. (And there can be a little bit of an odor in rooms on the 2nd floor.) But I've always found the staff to be very helpful and friendly--particularly the front door staff. (I love the fact that most NYC hotels will loan you big umbrellas during the rain, by the way.) Two minor annoyances: 1) finding the hotel can be a challenge (6 Columbus Circle isn't actually an address--you need to give the cabbie the cross streets and the entry to the hotel is marked with a simple "6" over the door in neon lights.) 2) As a very frequent business traveler, I hate having to stop at the front desk to check out in the morning--can't you leave the bill under my door in the morning? But generally it's a very convenient hotel and offers good value.

Reviews.Title: “Even better then last time”
Reviews.Author: ChangT
Reviews.Content: After our first nice stay in may we decided to revisit New York and went for the same hotel again. We arrived at the hotel and were greeted by a very efficient and charming receptionist even the doorman remembered us. Particularly liked the individual reception desks, making checking in quick and easy. This time we book one of the suites and we were impessed with our room it was clean and spacious and the spectacular view of the central park. Bed extremely comfortable, bathroom clean and well equipped. All the staff were courteous and attentive. The bar area was fairly busy on our return from the theatre Saturday night but we were still served with decilious cocktails quite quickly by a very nice waitress. Breakfast was good in the japanese restaurant, the Blue Rippon itseft is excellent as I took every lunch there . All staff were friendly and seemed happy in their jobs.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: nycfashiongirl
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here numerous times for business however this time I really wanted to write a review considering how amazing the staff was. At check in my reservation showed up as cancelled however the great girl at the front desk (i wish i could remember her name) took care of the situation in minutes and offered me an upgrade. Everything from the bell staff and housekeeping were amazing. Yes, the room is quite small but when you get such wonderful service and the hotel is spotless, why stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “As expected from the reviews”
Reviews.Author: LMSP
Reviews.Content: We were in NY to visit the Met for opera. This hotel is very conveniently located and relatively good value. Small room but everything was there and decent quality. Excellent breakfast and helpful staff. Good for a short trip for which I was paying but I might have wanted more space for a longer trip or if it was business.

Reviews.Title: “Good, not great”
Reviews.Author: HoneymoonersThailand
Reviews.Content: Service was quite good, except for the fact that they were not able to fix the a/c properly for 4 days. Rooms & lobby look great, but very little storage space in the room (no drawers, one small closet) or in the bathroom for toiletries, which was pretty uncomfortable. Pretty good value for NYC.

Reviews.Title: “horrendous hotel”
Reviews.Author: gtoren
Reviews.Content: rooms are like a crypt. windowless, tiny, dark. missing toiletries, broken safe. simply a disgrace to charge $280 for this place. embarrassing. worst value for money in NYC i have every encountered. staff lacks

Reviews.Title: “No Good for Priceline Customers”
Reviews.Author: squeakers3
Reviews.Content: I won this hotel on Priceline for a weekend in June. When I arrived, I saw that I had been assigned to the small POD room which is only suitable for one person. I was planning to have my sister join me the next day so I asked for a room with at least a Queen bed and was told the hotel was completely sold out and nothing larger was available. When I went up to my room, I checked the hotel website on my computer and that indicated that there were plenty of rooms available with Queen and King beds so apparently the front desk staff have been instructed to only issue POD rooms to Priceline customers and then lie to them if they ask for anything larger. This is in violation of the agreement this hotel has with Priceline in which they indicate they will treat a Priceline customer the same as anyone else. Because this room was so small and dark, I called my sister and told her not to bother coming after all since the room was not large enough to accommodate two people with any degree of comfort. I know this hotel considers itself 4-star but when you get a 2-star room in a 4-star hotel, it's no deal. I've had much nicer rooms in 2.5 star tourist class hotels in NYC than the one I was given at 6 Columbus. I've stayed in many different NYC hotels and this is the first time I've ever been discriminated against because I booked through Priceline so I will no longer choose the Central Park zone to avoid getting this hotel again. That's unfortunate because the other hotels in this zone do not give Priceline customers lesser treatment and I'll miss out on being able to stay in these true 4-star hotels as a result of this experience. In case anyone from the hotel reads these reviews, if you consider Priceline customers to be inferior to your other clientele, why do you bother participating with Priceline? It's not mandatory. On the plus side, your doormen are great, always very pleasant and accommodating. Too bad they're not running the place.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT!”
Reviews.Author: mp4mk
Reviews.Content: Great little bou tique hotel with some of the BEST service I have ever had in NY! LOVED the room AND the bathroom! Bed and pillows were super comfy. The staff was so friendly...I felt like I was in a new New York! Location couldn't be better! Definitely a place to go back to!!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel. Well located. Top service. Will definitely go back”
Reviews.Author: dantey
Reviews.Content: If you are looking to stay near the UWS this hotel is great. It also is a comfortable walk to the theatre district. We got an upgrade to a lovely room with a deck. Very happy with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Teeny tiny rooms but very nice staff”
Reviews.Author: 1militaryspouse
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at 6 Columbus with some family and friends, and we were all very pleased with the hotel. We all received a complimentary upgrade to a King Deluxe room from Queen Superior. The rooms were teeny tiny, as almost all hotel rooms in NYC are, but the staff was very nice and helpful. The halls and rooms are dark, lighting is not very good if you need to do work. The beds were comfortable and there was good water pressure in the shower. The hotel is convenient to lots of things, including the subway which is literally across the street. The hotel is located next to the Starbuck's, on 58th between 8th and 9th. It's not hard to find, actually very obvious once you see the awning, but the GPS in our phones took us someplace else. We would definitely consider going back here for another stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great One Nighter”
Reviews.Author: kcourtney81
Reviews.Content: Small room but it was clean and modern. Came back after going to dinner and show and they had put Cookies and little buns with a jar of Tupelo Honey. It was a nice surprise. The only complaint is the maids slam the doors while cleaning otherwise it's a very quiet place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mike0190
Reviews.Content: Stayed at 6 Columbus with my girlfriend and her family for 5 days and we found it to be an excellent hotel. Location wise its spot on being close to Central Park, Columbus Circle and a five minute walk to Fifth Avenue or Times Square. It also has a Starbucks next door which is handy. The hotel and room are well presented, and whilst the room was slightly small its what you would expect for a city break and didn't really impact on our stay. The bathroom was of a high standard too. Apart from the location what really made our stay was the service of the staff, and in particular the concierge (Eric, I think), who recommended a number of places to eat which were perfect for us. We would definitely recommend this hotel for anyone visiting New York and will probably stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE - THEY STEAL YOUR CLOTHES!”
Reviews.Author: lhardyyeste
Reviews.Content: My boss stayed here and when he checked out he left a jacket and a pair of slacks. We called the next day and were told that they had the items and we asked them to mail them. I called the next week and was told that they did not mail the items and could not locate the items at that time and to call back. I called back and spoke with Kostas, he said that the room in which the items may be could not be opened at that time and he would call me back. I did not receive a return phone call. I called again and was told that the head of housekeeping would get back with me, no return call. I called again and left word for the general manager on Monday, Jan. 14, no return phone call. I called again on Thursday, Jan. 20 and was given the run around, hung up on, put through to the Sales Coordinator when I asked for the GM or Housekeeping Manager and I have had it. I am going to send them a bill and I will make sure everyone we know is aware of what terrible customer NO service this hotel has, it is awful!

Reviews.Title: “Chic Hotel in a Great Location, but...,”
Reviews.Author: kelmac48
Reviews.Content: Our taxi driver couldn't find the hotel, as 6 Columbus Circle puts you right in front of the Time Warner Center. Not to worry, we saw the hotel through an arch way -- it's located on W58th street, just south of the Columbus Circle. Peter, the doorman/bell, helped us with our bags and was great through out our stay. We arrive early, as we had just disembarked from the Queen Mary 2 in Brookyln, and had to wait a bit as they searched to see if a room was available before noon. We had booked on Priceline, but they had no reservation in the hotels system; this would turn out to be a huge hassle at check out! The clerk who checked us in was nice and said she would solve the problem. She took our paper work to the manager, and he did upgrade us to a King room on the 9th floor, but didn't fix the problem with the booking. While we were waiting for a room, Perry the concierge was super helpful and even checked us in for our flight the next day. Can't say enough positive things about the out front staff of Peter and Perry! In their quest to be chic and different (like fur lined walls), the hotel has poor lighting and everything is dark and a bit strange. Having said that, we did enjoy our stay and our room was clean and in a good location. (no street noise) The location of the 6 Columbus Circle Hotel is perfect! At check out, we had a different clerk and she tried to charge us for the room, and once again I had to produce my paperwork. The whole time this is going on, Peter is holding a taxi for us outside, for our trip to the airport. After 30 minutes of back and forth with the manager in the back, we just told them to fix it and we had to leave. It took two calls to Priceline after we returned home to finally fix the issue. Seems this hotel is a small fish in the big booking pond and their system is flawed. The clerk admitted they always have problems with Priceline bookings. I would recommend this hotel, but if you book it through a third party, I would call the hotel directly and make sure they have your booking!

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, a bit expensive”
Reviews.Author: Maxtheviper
Reviews.Content: The 6 Columbus Hotel is a very well placed hotel near to the subway and to everything in Manhattan. Rooms are small but hotel is modern and clean. Price is not low but considering we are in Ny os acceptable. If you want the Central Park as a big part of your experience in Ny then you are in the perfect location, going out for a run in the park is 2 mins.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION...BUT THE HOTEL LEAVES A LOT TO BE DESIRED!”
Reviews.Author: starr70
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just finished visiting the city and I must say we had a lot of fun, but the 6 Columbus will not see me again. For over $500 a night the room was terribly small. There was barely enough room to put our suitcases in. I have seen larger dog houses! The bathroom was very small and the lighting was extremely bad. Did I mention the room we were in? I mean the 3 rooms we were in. When we checked in, the first room they put us in had no heat. We were moved, the second room the heat did not work either, they sent up a space heater and moved us the next day. 3 different rooms in 3 days! For $500 a night you would think they would have heat. Also, they charge $10 a day for internet service. This is not the 90's; It is 2010. I now have buyer's remorse. I would not recommend the hotel. Period. I feel sorry for the staff that works there. They kept explaining that they understood and they were telling the manager, but he would not do anything. If you stay here, beware!

Reviews.Title: “Confused by all of the good reviews!”
Reviews.Author: ebm515
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on a work trip and was very disappointed. i am not sure the exact level of the room i stayed in, but for $450 a night i would assume it wasn't the cheapest. it was the smallest room ever (and i have stayed in lots of nyc hotels) with no place to put anything but a very skinny desk that didn't even have a chair. luckily i just had a small bag but if you had a suitcase you would be in trouble! the hotel is definitely in an old building and for some reason all of their doors slam. you would think it would be easy to prevent them for slamming but they haven't fixed that. there were doors slamming all night. everything just felt digny. the elevator was dirty, the hall ways smelled terrible, and there was no lighting at all in the room. only upside was the location.

Reviews.Title: “Candy Six”
Reviews.Author: theanders
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Six Columbus for our anniversary break. It was a gorgeous hotel, our room was very stylish and a good size too. The bathroom was very modern, but the bath was a little too small, and that's perhaps the only downside if you like a good soak. We had an excellent range in the minbar and there were lots of nice snacks available too. We received a complimentary newspaper every morning and our room cleaning and service was impeccable. The hotel also left a anniversary treat in our room, which was really thoughtul and delicious! The staff are extremely friendly and accommodating and the Concierge was excellent too, finding us a couple of great restaurants. Though, we have to say the on-site Japanese bar and grill is fantastic! We had an amazing sushi dinner and magnificent bento breakfast and plenty drinks at the bar too. Really great location, minutes from Central Park, subways, shops. We would not hesitate to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Big value can come in a tiny package”
Reviews.Author: graphicouture
Reviews.Content: The room was on the small end but the comfort and value were on the high. Located in one of the best areas of the city, right on Columbus Circle close to Central Park and Times Square, but without the extraordinarily high prices you see for most hotels in this area of the city. The bed and linens were so soft and the noise of the bustling outside were hardly even noticeable; I had a superb night of sleep and was ready for my business meetings early the next day. And if you are a sushi fan like me, they have an outstanding bar/restaurant attached to the lobby where you can indulge after your long day. The level of service at the hotel was adequate but not as attentive as some other hotels I've stayed at. All in all great little place for a quick business trip that won't cause your boss' travel budget to explode.

Reviews.Title: “Please don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: balloffire
Reviews.Content: First the positives.Absolutely brilliant location.Near to everything.Central park,5th avenue,Time Warner Centre,Lincoln Centre.Can't fault it. Now for the negatives.I booked a studio suite just like another reviewer only to find it to be a poky room with a hard floor,a terrace i couldn't access(due to construction).Absolutely no seating available except an office type chair and a small desk which was virtually unusable. The aircon was so noisy it was impossible to sleep.The elevators were always busy because housekeeping staff used them for taking used laundry sown to basement etc.There is obviously no service lift available.Often had to wait at least 10 mins . The photos bore no resemblance to the actual room. I found the reception manager to be unfriendly and inefficient.When I requested the king suite instead was told yes it was available and then when i came to move they found it to be reserved.However i could have the loft suite for 750 dollars per night if i wanted! The bell service was also poor and despite the bell man coming up with me to my room to collect my luggage,He had disappeared two seconds later so i had to lug my two suitcases myself. all in all I paid $390 plus the inevitable $60 dollars state,city,occupancy convention tax!) for a poor substandard room.The word suite was a joke.Try studio box room. Please dont stay here there are far better choices available in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean, modern, cozy.”
Reviews.Author: Awynott
Reviews.Content: Booked three nights here at the last minute during fashion week. Super friendly staff! The concierge bent over backwards finding a tailor that could alter a dress I needed in two hours. Also had a great salon rec for a quick bang trim. The hotel is very clean, modern and new. Great sushi restaurant downstairs as well. Rooms are small but didn't bother me at all. It's New York and it just made it feel cozy really.

Reviews.Title: “this place is a hidden jewel”
Reviews.Author: pokergina
Reviews.Content: ive read the other reviews. if u r looking for tons of space, u r in the wrong city. and i have stayed in smaller rooms for more money. this place is now our go-to hotel any time we visit ny. and who needs the loud midtown area when u have the subway station practically at ur doorstep? the bedding was exquisite and the bathrooms were clean, modern and w good water pressure (not always easy to get in ny).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LYHD
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location, very close to Central Park, near Columbus Circle, the staff is very nice and the restaurant i very good too. But, the room was very small. I do recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “superb location, with great staff”
Reviews.Author: indypiano
Reviews.Content: I travel to NYC often, but first time at this hotel. Because of the great location and pleasant staff, will stay here again. Room and bath are small, but efficient and well-designed. I understand some of the concerns voiced by other reviewers, but my experience was good for a solo, short-term business trip. Room desperately needs a lamp on the desk- impossible to do any work in the room as the lighting is all 'mood" lighting and not good for tasks. No iron in the room. I requested one, but did not show up. My room was quiet, mostly due to quiet neighbors, but yes, the walls are thin and you can hear other guests. Staff was cordial and helpful- and some were genuinely charming and funny. I would not call the hotel a hot spot, but it is trying to be trendy in its design style. I was comfortable here and will stay here again- at least as a single traveler. The room would be tight for two people.

Reviews.Title: “overrated for sure”
Reviews.Author: GPeto
Reviews.Content: The location is superb...no doubt about that. Most of the rooms are so small that its hard to imagine staying there more then a night. The interior design is not my style and the lights in the room are weak. You might think your in a crypt. The breakfast is a JOKE. Its performed by the japanes restaurant in the hotel. I ordered a omlette and received it in a bento box. Now thats funny. All in all i think this hotel is not worth the money. A few 100 meters up the road you is the Library. If chic hotels are ur cup of tea then that should be better for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location!”
Reviews.Author: AprilML
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant to book this hotel based on the mediocre reviews on tripadvisor. We stayed in a king suite, which I felt was more than enough space for our family with two children. The linens were very soft and beds very comfortable. My mother in law had no complaints about the sofa bed, which also seemed very large. The location of the hotel is great; steps away from central park, whole foods grocery, several restaurants, a wine and liquor shop, and time warner shopping. We went to the theatre district for the Lion King which was also a short distance from the hotel. The absolute best part of our stay was the staff at the hotel. From the time I booked the hotel, Audrey was very friendly and helpful. Requests for sofa-bed turn down were answered within 5-10 minutes. The doormen were eager to help with anything we could possibly need. The only drawback to the weekend was that the window was stuck open the first night and the traffic sounds kept us awake. When we called the next morning, the front desk promised to fix the window or move us to a quieter room. Soon, our window was fixed and the room was very quiet for the next night's sleep. The price,based on location, customer service and amenities was very reasonable. We will certainly return to this hotel on fr our next trip to Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Only ok.”
Reviews.Author: Connecticut06
Reviews.Content: First for the negative. We stay in Manhattan often, but our room was small by any standard. It was also very noisy and had some positively bizarre design features---e.g. drawers located under the bed with pulls sharp enough to cause a nice scratch when getting out of bed, a bathroom with absolutely no horizontal space for your stuff, a safe at floor level which could be used only by scrunching down between the bed and cabinet in a most uncomfortable way. I guess dark is trendy, but we needed a flashlight to find the correct elevator button. Now for the positive----absolutely great location (especially if enjoying events at Lincoln Center). Wonderful, friendly staff (even if at check in we were "upgraded" to a room type we had already reserved). If location is the driver, this is a great hotel. Othwerwise, much there are more charming options for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay anywhere near the airshaft/void”
Reviews.Author: spbyrne
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at many Thompson Hotels over the years and while the room, staff and overall standard was great i could not sleep in a room that was next to the void and whistled all night. Perhaps this was a one off but I suspect not. Avoid any of these rooms. One gripe about all of the NY Thompson Hotels is they charge $10 for internet access. Take a leaf from the Standard LA, James in Chicago and give it to guests for free. It's a boutique hotel after all. Where's your point of difference?

Reviews.Title: “Mom & Daughter Overnight”
Reviews.Author: Allybeth
Reviews.Content: I live in NYC. I chose this hotel for the convenience & the cost. My daughter is in elementary school & I took her for a night in "The City". It was all good. here's the details... Small hotel, tiny room, cool NYC vibe & great location. The only drawback is that this hotel is dimly lit on purpose. Dark hallways, elevator, etc... Keep in mind that this is a good review! When being a tourist in Manhattan nothing is affordable, easy to do or obvious. Therefore I chose a simple route. Most of us stay in a big city to SEE the big city. Across the street is Central Park, Time Warner's trendy shopping center, & the Upper West Side is right there! If you come to Manhattan looking for something "Wow & Fabulous", go to the generic Times Square hotels w/ a view of the large neon signs & tons of people for lots of money. This lovely little hotel is for those of us looking for a comfortable & simple vacation. Sleep well & off you go to explore!

Reviews.Title: “not our definition of "luxury"”
Reviews.Author: travelnut1945
Reviews.Content: Clearly, the person who writes the copy for the promotional literature and website has never stayed here! We booked a studio suite (the next most expensive category), which was extremely small and barely furnished--a small side chair, as table too small to be useful. Virtually no storage--only a couple of drawers under the bed...which were on the wrong side of the bed and virtually inaccessible. Not even a throw rug on the bare floor!!!! Our room bore no relationship whatever to the photo of the Studio Suite on the website. Because no slippers were provided (nice hotels usually do), we had to wear our shoe bags to avoid walking on cold hard floors! Weird. Only one bathrobe in the room (we had to call for a second one); neither bathrobes nor the very small bath towels could ever be considered fluffy. And a person under 5'7" tall cannot see in the bathroom mirror. Worst of all, our room had not been cleaned when we returned at 3 pm. When we called to inquire, the front desk said , "Well, you must have had your Do Not Disturb tag on your door." Not, "We're very sorry; we'll fix that right away." Needless to say, we did NOT have our Do Not Disturb tag out. We ordered from room service 3 times--simple things--and it was never correct. And not very good quality--definitely minimalist. We did, however, haave an excellent meal of sushi, sahimi, etc in the restaurant on the first floor. This place should present itself for what it really is: a very basic hotel in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD VALUE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Sunseeker_mtl
Reviews.Content: Took ipod room it is small (NY size) but well appointed very modern and place to put clothes even drawer under the bed, bathroom is good size quiet large for size of room was surprised. (no lotion...but bathrobe no slippers) For the price 150$ you cannot get better The location is great for visiting Turn down service very appreciated and morning newspaper The ventilation when is on is making noise like in most hotels of that category as well you hear the next room open and close door because doors are making terrible noise Bed confortable Staff efficient Internet 10$ per day should be free especially when I stayed was not working in the afternoon Will go back if rate max 200$

Reviews.Title: “Not complety satisfied”
Reviews.Author: Planetadict
Reviews.Content: Definitely a good price range hotel for the location and services provided. However, the bar is very expensive and so is the restaurant. Rooms are tiny but clean and well built. Location is excellent. Main issue... elevators... I think I spent 30% of my hotel time waiting for one. The air conditionning wasn't working properly also, they tried to fix it... without success. Personel was really helpful though. I would recommend this hotel still, if your a mid-town or central park fan!

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE - READ THIS BEFORE BOOKING”
Reviews.Author: travelsalot1111
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot, so I know that boutique hotels (code word for tiny rooms) can be like. I arrived in NYC when most of the midtown hotels were filled up, so I stayed here. Big mistake. The room is tiny -- MUCH smaller than my college dorm -- no desk, no chair to put things on, no table, so you literally spread your stuff all over the floor, and there isn't even much of that. For the $220 I paid (before tax), the bathroom comes with a bottle of shampoo and no conditioner and no lotion. They couldn't spend the extra dollar for one of those tiny conditioner and lotion bottles? Also, for the $220, I you get just one bar of soap, not one for the sink and one for shower, although I could live with that I suppose. I'm just showing you the pattern here -- for your hundreds of dollars, you're buying a Motel 6 experience. Copying a style from Germany, the beds have a bottom sheet but no top sheet -- just a comforter. But the comforter isn't a REAL comforter, it just looks like one. It's really no warmer than a VERY light weight blanket. If you arrive in NYC during cold whether, and you like to keep the room at 65 or 68 degrees at night, you will freeze because, above your body is no sheet, just a very light-weight blanket. So you need to turn the thermostat up to 75 degrees or something to stay comfortable. By the way, whether you put it on cool or heat, the sound the air vent makes is a LOUD ROAR. If you guess the wrong temperature, you might, as I did, wake up in the middle of the night sweating heavily. Finally I had enough and called the front desk and asked for a two blankets and a sheet, so I could turn this into a real bed. So the bellman brings me a sheet and two towels. So then I called the manager, who told me they were out of blankets! What would you do in this situation if you were me? I'm a pretty easy-going guy, but at this point I lost it and yelled at him. He offered to bring me a space heater. I asked him what would a space heater do? I told him that if he had no blankets -- and ALL hotels have extra blankets except this one -- hen fine, I'll freeze or boil to death or whatever, just take half off my bill. What do you know, when I brought up $$$$, he mysteriously "found" anther of the fake comforters. So now I had an extra sheet and two fake comforters, i.e. two very, very light blankets. I'm actually writing this in the middle of the night, having been up for an hour with this nonsense. I'm going to put the sheet and the the other light-weight blanket on the bed and try and go back to sleep. Summary: You'd need to be insane to stay here. By the way, since he heater/air conditioner is so incredibly loud, I did take the manager up on the space heater offer, thinking that at least that would be quieter. Nope -- the thing was so battered and old that it made even more noise than the room heater, and believe me, that isn't easy. if you're in Ne York on business and need your sleep, or if you really need a good night sleep because you're here on vacation and have an active schedule, then all the more reason to avoid this place like the plague. On my last trip, for the same price, I found a room at the Hilton New York on Avenue of the Americas, just 6 small blocks away, and even though that hotel is huge, it's got a fun vibe, you get a nice-sized room, you get conditioner and lotion, each bed has a blanket and comforter, each room has an extra blanket in it, and you're even more in the heart of things in terms of location. Most importantly, you will sleep well.

Reviews.Title: “Price on website too good to be true, Literally!”
Reviews.Author: palmster
Reviews.Content: Checked in 2 days before the big snow storm in NYC. I booked a pod room on the website for $150 for two nights. Room was very hip, very nicely updated but that was it. It was a smallish double bed, reading lights on headboard were not working. Despite putting the heat up to max, cold air cranked all night in the dead of winter. So I shut it off and froze under the very thin down douvet. (no extra blankets in room or top sheets on the bed) The Douet was so starched that the flakes were all over the bed! In the bathroom the tiled floor was supposed to be heated. Not! I left my contact lens solution next to the window in the bathroom and due to the lack of heat overnight, when I woke up it was getting crunchy (starting to freeze). My shave cream was indeed frozen. Hair dryer was missing, so after a night of no sleep as I shivered in my bed, I looked like crap the next day for work. Upon asking the front desk first thing in the morning for a room change (asked them to move my luggage while I was at work) and an upgrade for the hassle, not only did they not relocate me before I returned, but they put me in another shoddy pod room. In this room I went to roll up the shade on the window to see what my view was and the entire mechanism fell off the window. Clearly this happened to the occupant before me. On another subzero night, I had nothing blocking the cold air from coming in. Although this time the heat did minimally work. These rooms are the size of my walk in closet at home. There is not much space to maneuver around the bed. Infact you feel like you are literally in a POD or a CELL. The shower stall in the next room must have been built on the wall right next to my bed. The walls are paper thin with zero insulation, I could hear the water running through the pipes and the sudsy couple cavorting for what seemed an eternity. $10 bucks per 24 hrs for WIFI, get lost! BUT YOU CAN STAY FOR $150. as the saying goes. YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR! Very hip and excellent Suhi bar in the lobby, but I'll take a pass coming back here to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fun hotel, great value.”
Reviews.Author: NYTraveler75
Reviews.Content: I live in NYC, and I had to move out of my apartment for a few days while I was having work done to it. I picked 6 Columbus because it was well rated here and a Tablet Hotel. The only room available was a pod room, for $99 per night. The room was small, but the bed was amazingly comfortable and the bathroom was a nice size and very clean. Some commenters have noted that you can hear sounds coming from other rooms - I found this to be the case only when there were people talking in the hallway, and it didn't bother me. I think the value for the price was incredible, and I would definitely recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Nice Space”
Reviews.Author: BooKat
Reviews.Content: Spent one night here earlier this week for spouse's business event. Location is perfect for anyone with an event at the Time Warner Center; it is directly across 58th street from one of the TW entrances. Received a good rate through quikbook and then was given an unexpected (but nice!) upgrade to a king studio on the 11th floor. The room was in the back of the hotel which was wonderful because there was absolutely no street noise; it was very quiet at night for sleeping. The room and the bathroom were HUGE by NY standards. It was freezing outside and although we turned the thermostadt up to 78, the room never went over 63-64 degrees, which was chilly. If we had been there more than one night we would have had to ask for it to be fixed. Room had both a big walk-in shower and a separate tub. Bed linens were warm, clean and comfortable. Bed itself was one of the most comfortable hotel beds I have ever experienced. Wood floor instead of carpet was very nice touch. Service at the front desk and with the valet/doormen was good. Did not try the hotel restaurant. Starbucks next door for coffee and a pharmacy on the corner. Would definitely stay here again if we return to this neighborhood of NYC.

Reviews.Title: “depends on price”
Reviews.Author: cokeandwet
Reviews.Content: At 180 a night (pod), I would stay at this place again--rooms are trendy nice, clean, and the hotel is in a good location. But, as some others have noted, the walls are paper thin(e.g. we could hear the neighbors conversation and TV) which is a big negative. But when all other comparable rooms hotels are 300+ I can live with it.

Reviews.Title: “Hip and well-located, but not practical for business”
Reviews.Author: whippetgood76
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at this hotel with a colleague, and I'm not sure I'd return. Pros were: comfy bed, roomy bathroom with heated floor, great location, friendly & helpful staff, very clean, decent price considering the location and season. Cons: Paper-thin doors with a large gap around the perimeter, which meant that the noisy family staying in the rooms adjacent to mine, who were ordering everything under the sun from room service and the bell hop, and arguing, could be heard all night long. No business center, but the staff printed some things for me. No desk, so it was difficult to work. No place to store luggage--I ended up putting my suitcases in the window, which had a view of nothing. Rooms were small (but that's New York), but the extremely dark decor made them seem even smaller--my friend remarked that it seemed like a ship cabin. For a place that prides itself on being high-end down to the last detail, I was surprised at how they skimped on toiletries--no lotion, and only one bar of soap, which meant I had to use the same bar for showering and washing my hands. A small annoyance, but when you're paying that much at a so-called high-end place, you would expect more. I switched to The Pod half-way through, which cost a third of 6 Columbus, and even though the room was smaller (I guess that's possible!), I felt more comfortable there because it was very light. The Pod also had ample toiletries, a desk, a great shower (I opted for an in-room bathroom) and FREE wi-fi (whereas it cost $10/day at 6 Columbus). And it was every bit as hip and clean, and only 2 blocks from the metro. Bottom line--6 Columbus is not good for a business trip, and I probably wouldn't stay there for a personal trip either, especially if I were with my spouse--we would be on top of each other and there wouldn't be enough room to store our belongings--there was barely enough room for just me. If it's hipness you're after, I would stay at the Pod instead, and have several hundred extra dollars in your pocket for fun. 6 Columbus' biggest asset is its location--literally steps from Columbus Circle and Central Park.

Reviews.Title: “Both good and bad points”
Reviews.Author: Annamazing
Reviews.Content: We were in town to see South Pacific at Lincoln Center. I chose this hotel because it was within walking distance to Lincoln Center and right across from the Time-Warner Building where we were having dinner (at The Porterhouse). When I called to make the reservation and asked for early check-in, I was told they would do their best. Well, I have to say that they did let us have the room at around 11AM. That was the good part. Now the bad: the room cost us $485 for ONE NIGHT and it was the size of a postage stamp. We quite literally could could barely walk around the bed. There was no room for our one suitcase. We had to store it on top of the very small closet in the room. Also, for some reason there was no top sheet on the bed; just a bottom sheet and a comforter on top. We will not be going back there ever.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel...Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Joewayrn
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for my 40th B-Day. Got Studio King Suite for great rate. Very nice and big room, hardwood floors and balcony. Comfortable bed and great shower pressure. 2 elevators in hotel, one was big and the other was barely enough for 2 people with luggage. Bellman and Front desk staff were great and helpfull. Food, Starbucks, train, Whole Foods, Central Park all within steps of hotel. Overall this is great hotel and plan on staying here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: jill_dublin2008
Reviews.Content: i stayed here for one night. we haggled the price for the room and he put it down by about 60$ . the hotel room is lovely. we got a king room.really clean and big.. loads of room. big bathroom with bath. very comfortable bed. tv ipod dock wardrobe. would recommend this hotel. nice and quiet. reception wer really nice. its a small hotel but conteporary design! but great room. we had breakfast the next morning in the restaurant and was really nice. great location

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: JIWM
Reviews.Content: While the contemporary-styled standard rooms here are small and lack the chairs, desk and dressers one might expect, the hotel makes up for it with a perfect location for Lincoln Center, the theater district and Central Park. From the smiling and talkative doorman to the speedy check in and check out receptionist to the friendly and capable housekeeper, the staff were all way above average.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: JoaoCardosoFernandes
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, very nice employees, with a modern 50's - 60's design and next to Central Park. For a first time in NY it's the best place to stay, Uptown.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect New York hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelerPhiladelphia
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on quikbook.com at an unbelievable rate of $270/night, 2 or 3 nights before our arrival. Everything else we looked at was over $300.
